wreathe.英释: If something is wreathed in smoke or mist, it is surrounded by it

scratch.英释: a small cut on someone’s skin

company.英释: a business organization that makes or sells goods or services

posture.英释: the way you position your body when sitting or standing

recycle.英释: to put used objects or materials through a special process so that they can be used again

canteen.中释: 食堂；小卖部；餐具箱；水壶
canteen.英释: a place in a factory, school etc where meals are provided, usually quite cheaply

supreme.中释: 最高的；最大的，最重要的
supreme.英释: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

cushion.英释: to make the effect of a fall or hit less painful, for example by having something soft in the way

edition.英释: the form that a book, newspaper, magazine etc is produced in

abridge.英释: to reduce the length of (a written work) by condensing or rewriting

steward.英释: a man whose job is to serve food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship

placard.英释: a large notice or advertisement on a piece of card, which is put up or carried in a public place

flavour.英释: the particular taste of a food or drink

exclaim.英释: to say something suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited

certify.英释: to state that something is correct or true, especially after some kind of test

revenue.英释: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

endorse.英释: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

lenient.英释: not strict in the way you punish someone or in the standard you expect

pompous.英释: someone who is pompous thinks that they are important, and shows this by being very formal and using long words – used to show disapproval

perplex.英释: if something perplexes you, it makes you feel confused and worried because it is difficult to understand

gallery.中释: 画廊，美术品陈列室；剧场顶层
gallery.英释: a large building where people can see famous pieces of art

whereas.英释: used at the beginning of an official document to mean ‘because of a particular fact’

janitor.英释: someone whose job is to look after a school or other large building

project.英释: If you project a film or picture onto a screen or wall, you make it appear there

mission.英释: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

glacier.英释: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

typical.英释: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

freight.英释: to send goods by air, sea, or train

compass.英释: an instrument that shows directions and has a needle that always points north

intense.英释: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

explode.英释: to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage

swallow.英释: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach

obscene.英释: relating to sex in a way that is shocking and offensive

preface.英释: an introduction at the beginning of a book or speech

profane.英释: to treat something holy with a lack of respect

secular.中释: 现世的，世俗的；非宗教的
secular.英释: not connected with or controlled by a church or other religious authority

revenge.英释: to punish someone who has done something to harm you or someone else

proceed.英释: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

graphic.英释: Graphic means concerned with drawing or pictures, especially in publishing, industry, or computing

console.英释: to make someone feel better when they are feeling sad or disappointed

attempt.英释: an act of trying to do something, especially something difficult

shamble.英释: to walk slowly and awkwardly, not lifting your feet much, for example because you are tired, weak, or lazy

segment.英释: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

defraud.英释: to trick a person or organization in order to get money from them

oppress.英释: to treat a group of people unfairly or cruelly, and prevent them from having the same rights that other people in society have

rampant.中释: (指植物)繁茂的；蔓生的；不能控制的
rampant.英释: a plant that is rampant grows and spreads quickly, in a way that is difficult to control

telling.英释: having a great or important effect

discard.英释: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

variety.中释: 多样化；种；变种；综艺演出
variety.英释: a lot of things of the same type that are different from each other in some way

utterly.英释: completely – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong

consist.英释: Something that consists of particular things or people is formed from them

reptile.英释: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

deprive.英释: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

outline.英释: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details

gesture.英释: a movement of part of your body, especially your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel

commute.中释: 交换，兑换；减轻；经常往来
commute.英释: to change the punishment given to a criminal to one that is less severe

triumph.英释: an important victory or success after a difficult struggle

liberal.中释: 慷慨的，大方的，胸怀宽大的
liberal.英释: generous or given in large amounts

smuggle.英释: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another

plunder.英释: to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere, especially while fighting in a war

disdain.英释: a complete lack of respect that you show for someone or something because you think they are not important or good enough

compile.英释: to make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc

classic.英释: a book, play, or film that is important and has been admired for a long time

premise.英释: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

gravity.英释: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

athlete.英释: someone who competes in sports competitions, especially running, jumping, and throwing

excerpt.英释: a short piece taken from a book, poem, piece of music etc

novelty.英释: the quality of being new, unusual, and interesting

deflate.中释: 使(轮胎)瘪下去 降低重要性

ecology.英释: the way in which plants, animals, and people are related to each other and to their environment, or the scientific study of this

receipt.英释: a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something

profuse.中释: 极其丰富的；很多的；大量的
profuse.英释: produced or existing in large quantities

checkup.英释: a general medical examination that a doctor or  dentist  gives you to make sure you are healthy

convene.英释: if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting

discern.英释: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

shimmer.英释: to shine with a soft light that looks as if it shakes slightly

venture.英释: a new business activity that involves taking risks

suspend.英释: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

dubious.英释: If you are dubious about something, you are not completely sure about it and have not yet made up your mind about it

justify.中释: 证明是正当的或有理的，为辩护
justify.英释: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

protein.英释: one of several natural substances that exist in food such as meat, eggs, and beans, and which your body needs in order to grow and remain strong and healthy

gradual.英释: happening slowly over a long period of time

recruit.英释: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc

mandate.中释: 命令，训令；授权(选民对代表)
mandate.英释: if a government or official has a mandate to make important decisions, they have the authority to make the decisions because they have been elected by the people to do so

crumple.英释: Crumple up means the same as

unravel.英释: if you unravel threads, string etc, or if they unravel, they stop being twisted together

propose.英释: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

fallacy.英释: a false idea or belief, especially one that a lot of people believe is true

zoology.英释: the scientific study of animals and their behaviour

solvent.英释: a chemical that is used to  dissolve  another substance

scandal.中释: 冒犯或引起反感的行动；流言，诽谤
scandal.英释: Scandal is talk about the shocking and immoral aspects of someone's behaviour or something that has happened

counsel.英释: a type of lawyer who represents you in court

stagger.英释: to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over

capsule.中释: 荚；装一剂药的小囊；密封舱
capsule.英释: a plastic container shaped like a very small tube with medicine inside that you swallow whole

generic.英释: relating to a whole group of things rather than to one thing

pursuit.英释: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

reverse.英释: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

tenable.中释: 可防守的，守得住的；可保持的，可维持的

dismiss.英释: to remove someone from their job

invoice.英释: a list of goods that have been supplied or work that has been done, showing how much you owe for them

enhance.中释: 提高(强度、力量、数量等)，增加(进)

display.英释: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy

journal.英释: a serious magazine produced for professional people or those with a particular interest

dwindle.英释: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

defence.中释: 防卫 防护 防御物 辩护 被告律师
defence.英释: something that you say or do in order to support someone or something that is being criticized

pliable.中释: 易弯的，柔韧的；易受影响的
pliable.英释: able to bend without breaking or cracking

violent.中释: 猛烈的，凶暴的；由暴力引起的；强烈的
violent.英释: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

combine.英释: a group of people, businesses etc who work together

disturb.英释: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing

entitle.英释: If the title of something such as a book, film, or painting is, for example, "Sunrise," you can say that it is entitled "Sunrise."

confine.英释: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject

condemn.中释: 谴责，迫使；判刑；宣告(建筑)不宜使用
condemn.英释: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

embassy.英释: a group of officials who represent their government in a foreign country, or the building they work in

forgive.英释: to stop being angry with someone and stop blaming them, although they have done something wrong

concoct.英释: to invent a clever story, excuse, or plan, especially in order to deceive someone

anxiety.英释: a feeling of wanting to do something very much

impetus.英释: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

symptom.英释: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

torrent.英释: a large amount of water moving very quickly and strongly in a particular direction

flatter.中释: 阿谀，使高兴；(肖像)等胜过(真人真物)

compact.英释: packed or put together firmly and closely

achieve.英释: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard

charity.中释: 赈济款、物；慈善团体；博爱
charity.英释: an organization that gives money, goods, or help to people who are poor, sick etc

pervade.英释: if a feeling, idea, or smell pervades a place, it is present in every part of it

salvage.中释: (从火灾及其他灾难中)抢救财物救助
salvage.英释: when you save things from a situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost

drought.英释: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

harness.英释: a set of leather bands used to control a horse or to attach it to a vehicle it is pulling

trivial.中释: 琐碎的，不重要的；平常的，平凡的

furnish.英释: to put furniture and other things into a house or room

address.中释: 向致词；在信封上写姓名
address.英释: if you address an envelope, package etc, you write on it the name and address of the person you are sending it to

resolve.英释: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty

inhabit.英释: if animals or people inhabit an area or place, they live there

oversee.英释: to be in charge of a group of workers and check that a piece of work is done satisfactorily

lateral.英释: relating to the sides of something, or movement to the side

dynamic.英释: something that causes action or change

violate.英释: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

jealous.英释: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had

sponsor.英释: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

inertia.英释: the force that keeps an object in the same position or keeps it moving until it is moved or stopped by another force

restore.英释: to make something return to its former state or condition

afflict.英释: to affect someone or something in an unpleasant way, and make them suffer

engross.英释: if something engrosses you, it interests you so much that you do not notice anything else

awkward.中释: 难使用的，笨拙的；尴尬的
awkward.英释: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

inhibit.英释: to prevent something from growing or developing well

shuttle.英释: to travel frequently between two places

destiny.英释: the things that will happen to someone in the future, especially those that cannot be changed or controlled

profile.英释: a side view of someone’s head

statute.英释: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down

diploma.英释: a document showing that someone has successfully completed a course of study or passed an examination

vibrate.英释: if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements

microbe.英释: an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a  microscope  . Some microbes can cause diseases.

fraught.英释: If a situation or action is fraught with problems or risks, it is filled with them

procure.英释: to obtain something, especially something that is difficult to get

trigger.英释: to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

nursery.英释: a place where young children are taken care of during the day while their parents are at work

protest.英释: something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

trickle.英释: if liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly in drops or in a thin stream

deserve.英释: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

orderly.中释: 整齐的；有秩序的；有条不紊的
orderly.英释: arranged or organized in a sensible or neat way

fantasy.英释: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen

manacle.英释: If a prisoner is manacled, their wrists or legs are put in manacles in order to prevent them from moving or escaping

suspect.英释: not likely to be completely true

cocaine.英释: a drug, usually in the form of a white powder, that is taken illegally for pleasure or used in some medical situations to prevent pain

tremble.英释: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened

scatter.英释: if someone scatters a lot of things, or if they scatter, they are thrown or dropped over a wide area in an irregular way

tension.中释: 紧张局势；情绪紧张；不安状态
tension.英释: the feeling that exists when people or countries do not trust each other and may suddenly attack each other or start arguing

exclude.中释: 把某人排除在外，排除(可能性等)

promote.英释: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

archaic.中释: (语言、词汇等)古代的，已不通用的

carrier.中释: 运货人；带菌者；运输军队的交通工具
carrier.英释: a company that moves goods or passengers from one place to another

deliver.英释: to make a speech etc to a lot of people

transit.英释: the process of moving goods or people from one place to another

summary.英释: done immediately, and not following the normal process

crooked.英释: bent, twisted, or not in a straight line

utility.中释: 有用，实用；公用事业(煤气，水电)
utility.英释: a service such as gas or electricity provided for people to use

ominous.英释: making you feel that something bad is going to happen

execute.中释: 实行，贯彻，实施；处死；演奏
execute.英释: to kill someone, especially legally as a punishment

prolong.英释: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

whereby.英释: by means of which or according to which

persist.英释: to continue to do something, although this is difficult, or other people oppose it

pastime.英释: something that you do because you think it is enjoyable or interesting

involve.英释: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

decimal.英释: a decimal system is based on the number 10

isolate.英释: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

sulphur.英释: a common light yellow chemical substance that burns with a very strong unpleasant smell, and is used in drugs, explosives, and industry. It is a chemical element :symbol S

qualify.英释: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

capture.英释: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

undergo.英释: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

inflict.英释: to make someone suffer something unpleasant

declare.中释: 宣告，声明；断言；申报应纳税物品
declare.英释: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

overdue.英释: not done, paid, returned etc by the time expected

lodging.中释: 寄宿，住所；(大学生的)校外宿舍

wrinkle.英释: wrinkles are lines on your face and skin that you get when you are old

contend.英释: to compete against someone in order to gain something

antonym.英释: a word that means the opposite of another word

squeeze.英释: to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand

torture.中释: 拷打，折磨，使受剧烈痛苦
torture.英释: an act of deliberately hurting someone in order to force them to tell you something, to punish them, or to be cruel

overall.英释: a loose-fitting piece of clothing like a coat, that is worn over clothes to protect them

species.英释: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

tenancy.英释: the period of time that someone rents a house, land etc

minimal.英释: very small in degree or amount, especially the smallest degree or amount possible

subsidy.英释: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

nurture.英释: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing

version.英释: someone’s version of an event is their description of it, when this is different from the description given by another person

subside.中释: 洪水退落；土地下沉；建筑物沉降
subside.英释: if a building or an area of land subsides, it gradually sinks to a lower level

trample.英释: to step heavily on something, so that you crush it with your feet

genuine.英释: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

augment.英释: to increase the value, amount, effectiveness etc of something

sincere.英释: a feeling, belief, or statement that is sincere is honest and true, and based on what you really feel and believe

glimmer.英释: a light that is not very bright

rupture.英释: an occasion when something suddenly breaks apart or bursts

leaflet.英释: a small book or piece of paper advertising something or giving information on a particular subject

initial.英释: to write your initials on a document to make it official or to show that you agree with something

counter.英释: to say something in order to try to prove that what someone said was not true or as a reply to something

current.英释: a continuous movement of water in a river, lake, or sea

distort.英释: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

context.英释: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

dispose.英释: to arrange things or put them in their places

capital.英释: an offence that is punished by death

remnant.英释: a small part of something that remains after the rest of it has been used, destroyed, or eaten

refusal.英释: when you say firmly that you will not do, give, or accept something

routine.英释: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do

funeral.英释: a religious ceremony for burying or  cremating (= burning )  someone who has died

corrode.英释: if metal corrodes, or if something corrodes it, it is slowly destroyed by the effect of water, chemicals etc

scalpel.英释: a small, very sharp knife that is used by doctors in operations

outcast.中释: 被遗弃的；被遗弃者，被逐出者
outcast.英释: someone who is not accepted by the people they live among, or who has been forced out of their home

compose.中释: 组成，构成；创作；排字；使安静
compose.英释: to write a piece of music

prelude.英释: if an event is a prelude to a more important event, it happens just before it and makes people expect it

culture.中释: 人类能力的高度发展，文化，教养，文明
culture.英释: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

glitter.英释: to shine brightly with flashing points of light

hygiene.英释: the practice of keeping yourself and the things around you clean in order to prevent diseases

smother.中释: 使窒息，使闷死；闷住；抑制；忍住
smother.英释: to kill someone by putting something over their face to stop them breathing

furnace.英释: a large container for a very hot fire, used to produce power, heat, or liquid metal

confess.英释: to admit something that you feel embarrassed about

crevice.英释: a narrow crack in the surface of something, especially in rock

slander.英释: a false spoken statement about someone, intended to damage the good opinion that people have of that person

magnify.英释: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

cricket.英释: a game between two teams of 11 players in which players try to get points by hitting a ball and running between two sets of three sticks

premium.英释: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year

oblique.英释: not looking, pointing etc directly at something

explore.英释: to travel around an area in order to find out about it

pungent.英释: having a strong taste or smell

indulge.英释: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them

vicious.英释: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

wrestle.英释: to fight someone by holding them and pulling or pushing them

arduous.英释: involving a lot of strength and effort

variant.英释: something that is slightly different from the usual form of something

council.英释: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

setting.中释: 镶嵌；环境，背景；(日月)沉落
setting.英释: the place where something is or where something happens, and the general environment

soluble.英释: a soluble substance can be  dissolved  in a liquid

portray.英释: to describe or represent something or someone

ashamed.英释: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

thermal.英释: relating to or caused by heat

pottery.英释: objects made out of baked clay

mediate.英释: to try to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc

scenery.英释: the natural features of a particular part of a country that you can see, such as mountains, forests, deserts etc

chronic.英释: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

sustain.英释: to make something continue to exist or happen for a period of time

veteran.中释: 老练者；老手；老兵；老式古董车
veteran.英释: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

embrace.英释: to put your arms around someone and hold them in a friendly or loving way

radical.中释: 根本的，基本的，政治激进的

prevail.英释: if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

essence.英释: the most basic and important quality of something

portion.英释: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

surplus.英释: an amount of something that is more than what is needed or used

odyssey.中释: 长途冒险旅行；一连串的冒险
odyssey.英释: a long journey with a lot of adventures or difficulties

session.英释: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

shutter.英释: one of a pair of wooden or metal covers on the outside of a window that can be closed to keep light out or prevent thieves from coming in

cripple.英释: to hurt someone badly so that they cannot walk properly

emotion.英释: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

erosion.英释: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

ghastly.中释: 苍白的；可怕的；令人不快的
ghastly.英释: making you very frightened, upset, or shocked

inspire.中释: 激励，鼓励，灌注以创造力
inspire.英释: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

volcano.英释: a mountain with a large hole at the top, through which lava(= very hot liquid rock ) is sometimes forced out

granary.英释: a place where grain, especially wheat, is stored

refugee.英释: someone who has been forced to leave their country, especially during a war, or for political or religious reasons

signify.英释: to represent, mean, or be a sign of something

convert.英释: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

extract.英释: a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

descend.英释: to move from a higher level to a lower one

perturb.英释: If something perturbs you, it worries you quite a lot

terrace.中释: 斜坡地，梯田；看台，大阶级
terrace.英释: the wide steps that the people watching a football match can stand on

plaster.英释: a substance used to cover walls and ceilings with a smooth even surface. It consists of  lime  , water, and sand.

disable.英释: to make someone unable to use a part of their body properly

antique.英释: a piece of furniture, jewellery etc that was made a very long time ago and is therefore valuable

voucher.英释: an official statement or receipt that is given to some­one to prove that their accounts are correct or that money has been paid

request.英释: a polite or formal demand for something

texture.中释: (织物)组织，结构；(材料)构造，结构
texture.英释: The texture of something, especially food or soil, is its structure, for example, whether it is light with lots of holes, or very heavy and solid

hostage.英释: someone who is kept as a prisoner by an enemy so that the other side will do what the enemy demands

crystal.中释: 水晶，水晶饰品，结晶体；最好的玻璃器皿

release.英释: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

visible.英释: something that is visible can be seen

pasture.英释: land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on

amateur.英释: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job

traitor.英释: someone who is not loyal to their country, friends, or beliefs

optimum.英释: the best or most suitable for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

perfume.英释: a liquid with a strong pleasant smell that women put on their skin or clothing to make themselves smell nice

nowhere.英释: not in any place or to any place

whistle.英释: to make a high or musical sound by blowing air out through your lips

monster.中释: 怪物；畸形的动植物；恶人
monster.英释: an imaginary or ancient creature that is large, ugly, and frightening

sparkle.英释: to shine in small bright flashes

torment.英释: to make someone suffer a lot, especially mentally

pageant.英释: A pageant is a colourful public procession, show, or ceremony. Pageants are usually held outdoors and often celebrate events or people from history.

politic.英释: sensible and likely to gain you an advantage

convict.英释: someone who has been proved to be guilty of a crime and sent to prison

penalty.英释: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

fortify.英释: to make someone feel physically or mentally stronger

monsoon.英释: the season, from about April to October, when it rains a lot in India and other southern Asian countries

pension.中释: 养老金，退休金；给予养老金
pension.英释: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill

stadium.英释: a building for public events, especially sports and large rock music concerts, consisting of a playing field surrounded by rows of seats

privacy.英释: the state of being free from public attention

auction.英释: a public meeting where land, buildings, paintings etc are sold to the person who offers the most money for them

welfare.英释: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

measure.中释: 量度，分量，尺寸；量具；行动，步骤
measure.英释: to know what someone’s strengths and weaknesses are, so that you are able to deal with them or defeat them

wording.英释: the words and phrases used to express something

nominee.英释: someone who has been officially suggested for an important position, duty, or prize

subject.英释: to force a country or group of people to be ruled by you, and control them very strictly

deviate.英释: to change what you are doing so that you are not following an expected plan, idea, or type of behaviour

optical.英释: relating to machines or processes which are concerned with light, images, or the way we see things

slender.中释: 细长的，苗条的；纤弱的，微小的，微薄的
slender.英释: thin in an attractive or graceful way

retreat.英释: to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle

shelter.中释: 隐蔽处；掩蔽，遮蔽；避难所
shelter.英释: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc

clarity.英释: the clarity of a piece of writing, law, argument etc is its quality of being expressed clearly

revolve.英释: to move around like a wheel, or to make something move around like a wheel

charter.英释: to say officially that a town, organization, or university officially exists and has special rights

poverty.英释: the situation or experience of being poor

spatial.英释: relating to the position, size, shape etc of things

tornado.英释: an extremely violent storm consisting of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage

neglect.英释: failure to look after something or someone, or the condition of not being looked after

sweater.英释: a piece of warm wool or cotton clothing with long sleeves, which covers the top half of your body

faculty.中释: 才能；(大学的)系科；学院全体教员
faculty.英释: a department or group of related departments within a university

surpass.英释: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

despise.英释: to dislike and have a low opinion of someone or something

deflect.英释: if someone or something deflects something that is moving, or if it deflects, it turns in a different direction

compute.英释: to calculate a result, answer, sum etc

hearing.中释: 听力，听力所及距离，被听到机会；审讯
hearing.英释: the sense which you use to hear sounds

ruinous.英释: causing a lot of damage or problems

uniform.英释: a particular type of clothing worn by all the members of a group or organization such as the police, the army etc

shallow.英释: measuring only a short distance from the top to the bottom

geology.英释: the study of the rocks, soil etc that make up the Earth, and of the way they have changed since the Earth was formed

mundane.英释: concered with ordinary daily life rather than religious matters

corrupt.英释: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way

hostile.中释: 敌对的，敌方的，不友好的
hostile.英释: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

contest.英释: a competition or a situation in which two or more people or groups are competing with each other

tarnish.中释: (尤指金属表面)失去光泽；玷污
tarnish.英释: if an event or fact tarnishes someone’s  reputation  , record, image etc, it makes it worse

surgery.英释: medical treatment in which a surgeon cuts open your body to repair or remove something inside

interim.英释: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found

applaud.英释: to hit your open hands together, to show that you have enjoyed a play, concert, speaker etc

amplify.英释: to increase the effects or strength of something

paradox.中释: 似是而非的论点；看似悖谬实则正确的观点
paradox.英释: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

reclaim.英释: to make an area of desert, wet land etc suitable for farming or building

offence.英释: an illegal action or a crime

precise.英释: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

overlap.中释: 与…互搭，与重叠，与部分相同
overlap.英释: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.

episode.中释: 一系列事件中的一个事件
episode.英释: a television or radio programme that is one of a series of programmes in which the same story is continued each week

thunder.英释: the loud noise that you hear during a storm, usually after a flash of lightning

outcome.英释: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

embargo.英释: an official order to stop trade with another country

digital.英释: using a system in which information is recorded or sent out electronically in the form of numbers, usually ones and zeros

complex.英释: a large number of things which are closely related

caption.中释: 报纸文章的标题；照片说明
caption.英释: A caption is the words printed underneath a picture or cartoon which explain what it is about

harbour.英释: to protect and hide criminals that the police are searching for

ovation.英释: if a group of people give someone an ovation, they clap to show approval

tragedy.英释: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

decline.英释: If something declines, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or strength

distend.英释: to swell or make something swell because of pressure from inside

miracle.英释: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

pervert.英释: someone whose sexual behaviour is considered unnatural and unacceptable

cartoon.英释: a short film that is made by photographing a series of drawings

circuit.英释: the complete circle that an electric current travels

enforce.英释: to make people obey a rule or law

concede.英释: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

elevate.英释: to lift someone or something to a higher position

horizon.英释: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

foresee.英释: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

shatter.英释: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

annuity.英释: a fixed amount of money that is paid each year to someone, usually until they die

cynical.英释: unwilling to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

eminent.英释: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

dialect.英释: a form of a language which is spoken only in one area, with words or grammar that are slightly different from other forms of the same language

pilgrim.英释: a religious person who travels a long way to a holy place

dictate.英释: to say words for someone else to write down

fervent.英释: believing or feeling something very strongly and sincerely

missile.英释: a weapon that can fly over long distances and that explodes when it hits the thing it has been aimed at

conquer.英释: to get control of a country by fighting

nourish.英释: to keep a feeling, idea, or belief strong or help it to grow stronger

tourism.英释: the business of providing things for people to do, places for them to stay etc while they are on holiday

pigment.英释: a natural substance that makes skin, hair, plants etc a particular colour

nullify.英释: to make something lose its effect or value

stumble.中释: 绊跌，绊倒；结结巴巴说话
stumble.英释: to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall

nucleus.英释: the central part of an atom, made up of neutrons, protons, and other elementary particles

languid.英释: moving slowly and involving very little energy

tighten.英释: to close or fasten something firmly by turning it

rejoice.英释: to feel or show that you are very happy

cordial.英释: friendly but quite polite and formal

exploit.英释: to treat someone unfairly by asking them to do things for you, but giving them very little in return – used to show disapproval

passive.英释: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

fanatic.英释: someone who has extreme political or religious ideas and is often dangerous

abandon.英释: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

therapy.英释: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

forfeit.英释: to lose a right, position, possession etc or have it taken away from you because you have broken a law or rule

fertile.中释: 肥沃的，创造力丰富的，能结果实的
fertile.英释: fertile land or soil is able to produce good crops

collide.英释: to disagree strongly with a person or group, especially on a particular subject

courier.中释: (旅行)服务员；信使；送急件的人
courier.英释: a person or company that is paid to take packages somewhere

frantic.中释: 激动得发狂似的；狂暴的
frantic.英释: If you are frantic, you are behaving in a wild and uncontrolled way because you are frightened or worried

relapse.英释: to become ill again after you have seemed to improve

contact.中释: 接触；联络；会晤的人；(电)接点
contact.英释: communication with a person, organization, country etc

provoke.英释: to cause a reaction or feeling, especially a sudden one

acquire.英释: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

enclose.英释: to surround something, especially with a fence or wall, in order to make it separate

despair.英释: a feeling that you have no hope at all

dentist.英释: someone whose job is to treat people’s teeth

cherish.中释: 爱护，抱有(希望)；怀有(情感)
cherish.英释: If you cherish someone or something, you take good care of them because you love them

disgust.英释: a strong feeling of dislike, annoyance, or disapproval

promise.英释: If you promise that you will do something, you say to someone that you will definitely do it

erratic.中释: 古怪的，反复无常的，不稳定的
erratic.英释: something that is erratic does not follow any pattern or plan but happens in a way that is not regular

comment.英释: an opinion that you express about someone or something

confuse.英释: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

succumb.英释: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control

dormant.英释: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

economy.英释: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way

finance.英释: the management of money by governments, large organizations etc

textile.英释: any type of woven cloth that is made in large quantities, used especially by people in the business of making clothes etc

opinion.英释: your ideas or beliefs about a particular subject

orchard.英释: a place where fruit trees are grown

grumble.英释: to keep complaining in an unhappy way

formula.英释: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule

inherit.中释: 继承，经遗传而得(特性等)
inherit.英释: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

turmoil.英释: a state of confusion, excitement, or anxiety

analogy.英释: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

witness.英释: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

insight.英释: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

insipid.中释: 无味的，枯燥乏味的；单调的
insipid.英释: food or drink that is insipid does not have much taste

caustic.中释: 腐蚀性的；刻薄的；苛刻的
caustic.英释: a caustic substance can burn through things by chemical action

verdict.英释: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

remorse.英释: a strong feeling of being sorry that you have done something very bad

caution.英释: the quality of being very careful to avoid danger or risks

entreat.英释: to ask someone, in a very emotional way, to do something for you

postage.英释: the money charged for sending a letter, package etc by post

vehicle.中释: 车辆交通工具；思想媒介
vehicle.英释: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

section.中释: 部分，零件；剖面，横断面，阶层
section.英释: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

captive.中释: 俘虏，迷恋者；被俘虏的，被拴住的
captive.英释: someone who is kept as a prisoner, especially in a war

tedious.英释: something that is tedious continues for a long time and is not interesting

audible.英释: a sound that is audible is loud enough for you to hear it

recline.英释: to lie or lean back in a relaxed way

radiate.英释: if something radiates light or heat, or if light or heat radiates from something, the light or heat is sent out in all directions

costume.英释: a set of clothes worn by an actor or by someone to make them look like something such as an animal, famous person etc

fixture.英释: Fixtures are fittings or furniture which belong to a building and are legally part of it, for example, a bathtub or a toilet

seclude.英释: to remove from contact with others

assault.英释: the crime of physically attacking someone

plummet.英释: to suddenly and quickly decrease in value or amount

notable.英释: important, interesting, excellent, or unusual enough to be noticed or mentioned

pointed.英释: having a point at the end

abolish.英释: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

imitate.英释: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

liaison.英释: the regular exchange of information between groups of people, especially at work, so that each group knows what the other is doing

cashier.英释: someone whose job is to receive or pay out money in a shop

startle.英释: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

reserve.英释: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

lottery.英释: a game used to make money for a state or a  charity  in which people buy tickets with a series of numbers on them. If their number is picked by chance, they win money or a prize.

synonym.英释: a word with the same meaning as another word in the same language

deplete.英释: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

compare.英释: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

pretext.英释: a false reason given for an action, in order to hide the real reason

surgeon.英释: a doctor who does operations in a hospital

maximum.英释: the largest number or amount that is possible or is allowed

somehow.英释: in some way, or by some means, although you do not know how

extinct.中释: 消灭了的，熄灭了的，绝种的
extinct.英释: an extinct type of animal or plant does not exist any more

diagram.英释: a simple drawing or plan that shows exactly where something is, what something looks like, or how something works

fitting.英释: an occasion when you put on a piece of clothing that is being made for you, to see if it fits properly

install.英释: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

consign.英释: to send something somewhere, especially in order to sell it

depress.英释: to make someone feel very unhappy

clarify.英释: to make something clearer or easier to understand

extreme.英释: a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

pertain.英释: If one thing pertains to another, it relates, belongs, or applies to it

seismic.英释: relating to or caused by  earthquakes

licence.英释: an official document giving you permission to own or do something for a period of time

impulse.英释: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

crucial.英释: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

twinkle.英释: if a star or light twinkles, it shines in the dark with an unsteady light

conform.英释: to obey a law, rule etc

minimum.英释: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary

deficit.英释: the difference between the amount of something that you have and the higher amount that you need

feature.中释: 脸一部分，面貌，特征，特写，故事片
feature.英释: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical

passion.英释: a very strong feeling of sexual love

ascribe.英释: If you ascribe an event or condition to a particular cause, you say or consider that it was caused by that thing

rectify.英释: to correct something that is wrong

flutter.中释: 振翼，颤动，(心脏)不规则跳动
flutter.英释: if your heart or your stomach flutters, you feel very excited or nervous

deposit.英释: an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

dignity.英释: the fact of being respected or deserving respect

glimpse.英释: a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

consult.英释: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

humdrum.英释: boring and ordinary, and having no variety or interest

stretch.英释: the action of stretching a part of your body out to its full length, or a particular way of doing this

article.英释: a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine

cunning.英释: the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

refrain.英释: to not do something that you want to do

equator.英释: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

eternal.英释: continuing for ever and having no end

harmony.英释: notes of music combined together in a pleasant way

plateau.英释: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

laundry.英释: clothes, sheets etc that need to be washed or have just been washed

crumble.英释: If something crumbles, or if you crumble it, it breaks into a lot of small pieces

commend.英释: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

deceive.英释: to make someone believe something that is not true

default.英释: failure to pay money that you owe at the right time

monitor.英释: to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

nominal.中释: 名义上的，有名无实的；极微的；象征性的
nominal.英释: a very small sum of money, especially when compared with what something would usually cost or what it is worth

content.中释: 满意(的)，满足(的)；使满意(足)

migrate.英释: if birds or animals migrate, they travel regularly from one part of the world to another

dilemma.英释: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

sarcasm.英释: a way of speaking or writing that involves saying the opposite of what you really mean in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed

garbage.英释: waste material, such as paper, empty containers, and food thrown away

flicker.英释: to burn or shine with an unsteady light that goes on and off quickly

chamber.中释: 房间；议院；贸易团体；弹膛
chamber.英释: a room used for a special purpose, especially an unpleasant one

recover.英释: to get back an ability, a sense, or control over your feelings, movements etc after a period without it

opening.中释: 口，孔；开始；张开；职位空缺
opening.英释: a hole or space in something

poultry.英释: birds such as chickens and ducks that are kept on farms in order to produce eggs and meat
